intro: Casparya oligocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved caspary, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Casparya oligocarpa is often used in ornamental gardening for its delicate foliage and historical medicinal uses.
